intro: Acrostichum obovatum, commonly known as the broad-leaf hibiscus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial plant characterized by its large, heart-shaped, obovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
